parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
From oninemi; profitable; Onesimus, a Christian.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From a variation of genos; to procreate; figuratively, to regenerate.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Or desmos des-mos' neuter and masculine respectively from deo; a band, i.e. Ligament or shackle; figuratively, an impediment or disability.
